senses.de: To go to or be present at an event, place, or activity
senses.ex: She will attend the meeting tomorrow.

Tips.title: Physical Presence
Tips.description: The word 'attend' implies actually being in the location of the event or activity.
Tips.example: He will attend the party at Susan's house.

Tips.title: Commitment Expected
Tips.description: 'Attend' often suggests you have agreed to be present and participate.
Tips.example: Maria agreed to attend the weekly team meetings.

Tips.title: Formal Occasions
Tips.description: 'Attend' is frequently used for formal or organized events such as ceremonies.
Tips.example: Many people attended the award ceremony downtown.

senses.de: To take care of or look after someone or something
senses.ex: Nurses attend the sick in hospitals.

Tips.title: Dedicated Assistance
Tips.description: 'Attend' shows special care or support for someone, not just casual help.
Tips.example: The nurse attentively attended to the injured man.

Tips.title: Ongoing Responsibility
Tips.description: Using 'attend' can indicate a continuous or regular duty to help someone.
Tips.example: The caretaker attends to the needs of the elderly daily.

senses.de: To deal with or manage something
senses.ex: She attended to the matter immediately.

Tips.title: Direct Focus
Tips.description: 'Attend to' suggests giving something your full and immediate attention.
Tips.example: He attended to the urgent email as soon as he arrived.

Tips.title: Professional Context
Tips.description: 'Attend to' is often used in a work or business context to discuss responsibilities.
Tips.example: The manager is attending to the client complaints.

senses.ex: Please attend to what the teacher is saying.
cl: attend to what someone is saying

Tips.title: Active Listening
Tips.description: 'Attend to' emphasizes actively listening or obeying, not just hearing sounds.
Tips.example: The students were asked to attend to the safety instructions.

Tips.title: Concentration Required
Tips.description: When 'attend to' is used, it means focus is needed, distractions should be avoided.
Tips.example: Attend to the speaker without checking your phone.

senses.de: In the past, to serve or wait upon someone, especially of high rank
senses.ex: The knights would attend the king during festivals.

Tips.title: Historical Service
Tips.description: 'Attend' in historical contexts often refers to personal service to royalty or nobility.
Tips.example: Squires were expected to attend their lords in battle and at court.

Attend to.wordDefinition:
Attend generally means to be present at an event, meeting, or class. For example, you might attend a lecture or an after-school club meeting.

The phrase attend to is a bit different. It means to focus your attention on something, often in order to take care of it or handle a problem.

For example, you might attend to a crying baby or attend to a customer's needs in a store.

So, in short, attend is about being present somewhere, while attend to is about paying attention to something that needs to be dealt with.

Care for.wordDefinition:
Attend means to be present at an event or function, and it can also mean to take care of someone or something. For example, you might attend a party or attend a doctor's appointment.

The phrase care for usually means to provide support or assistance to someone or something. For example, you might care for your pets, your siblings, or your elderly grandparents.

Attend focuses more on being present or paying attention to something, while care for focuses on providing assistance or support to someone or something.

Handle.wordDefinition:
Attend means to be present at an event or situation, while the word handle means to manage or deal with a situation or problem.

For example, you attend a party, but you handle a difficult situation at work.

Handle is used when referring to dealing with a problem or situation, such as handling a customer complaint or handling an emergency.

Attend is related to being present, while handle is related to managing or dealing with something.

Join.wordDefinition:
Join means to become a member of a group, organization or a team. For example, you join a club, a sports team or a community group.

Attend refers to the action of being present while join refers to becoming a member.

Look after.wordDefinition:
Look after means to take care of someone or something. It is applicable when you are responsible for taking care of someone, like a child or a pet.

You can also look after a house or a garden.

Attend is about being there, while look after is about taking care of something or someone.

Mind.wordDefinition:
Mind means to be careful or to pay attention to something. For example, when you ask someone to mind their manners, you are asking that person to be careful about their behavior.

Attend is used when you are physically present at a particular place, whereas mind is used when you want someone to be careful or pay attention to something specific.

Participate.wordDefinition:
Participate means to take part in something actively. This implies contributing to the event or activity, being involved in various aspects, and engaging in the event on a more personal level.

However, if you participate in a party game, you are actively contributing and engaging in the party.

Attending is usually used when you are going to an event or gathering as a spectator or observer, while participating suggests involvement and active engagement.

Show up.wordDefinition:
Attend means to be present at a specific event, location or activity and to actively participate or engage in it, while show up means to simply arrive or appear at a specific event or location without necessarily participating or engaging in it.

However, if you simply show up at the concert, you might be there but not necessarily participating in any way.

If you just show up at the meeting, you might be there but not necessarily engaging or participating actively.

Attend is applicable when you want to emphasize active participation or engagement in an event, location or activity, while show up is applicable when you simply want to emphasize presence or arrival at a specific event or location.

videos.Text: I mean, you'd want to find out what's going on with him, right? They asked to attend our bedside rounds where we discussed his condition and his plan, which I thought was a reasonable request, and also would give us a chance to show them how much we were trying and how much we cared. The head doctor, though, said no. He gave all kinds of reasons.

quotes.Text: For me, education has never been simply a policy issue - it's personal. Neither of my parents and hardly anyone in the neighborhood where I grew up went to college. But thanks to a lot of hard work and plenty of financial aid, I had the opportunity to attend some of the finest universities in this country.
quotes.Title: American First Lady
quotes.Name: Michelle Obama

quotes.Text: Follow your passion. The rest will attend to itself. If I can do it, anybody can do it. It's possible. And it's your turn. So go for it. It's never too late to become what you always wanted to be in the first place.
quotes.Title: American Producer
quotes.Name: J. Michael Straczynski

quotes.Text: There are a lot of children in our country that, because of their neighborhood or socio-economic status, do not have the opportunity to attend a good school that will prepare them for life's challenges.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jared Polis

quotes.Text: My mother always took my brothers and me to music lessons. There were six children. Our parents attended our concerts and encouraged us to study and enjoy many different types of music.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Wynton Marsalis

quotes.Text: Going out with friends for a nice dinner and then attending the midnight mass are some of the memories I cherish.
quotes.Title: Indian Musician
quotes.Name: Neha Kakkar

quotes.Text: Attending USC has been such a great experience for me and has really helped prepare me for my next step in life.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: O. J. Mayo

quotes.Text: The greatest compliment that was ever paid me was when one asked me what I thought, and attended to my answer.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.Text: Art is changing. Again. Here. Now. Opportunities to witness this are rare, so attend and observe.
quotes.Title: American Critic
quotes.Name: Jerry Saltz

quotes.Text: I was raised a Christian. I'd like to think I have Christian values. I don't attend church.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Gary Johnson

quotes.Text: I was born and raised in Maryland and attended the public school system.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Brendan Iribe
